subhead: The US president played up his role in resolving the conflict between Israel and the Islamic Republic. On the ground, explosions were heard in Tehran and Iranian missiles killed at least four people in Beersheba.

subhead: The secretary-general of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, who has been in office for nine months, has strived to balance both the demands of the Trump administration and tension among Europeans.

title: Oman taxing the richest: 'It will be interesting to see if Muscat starts a trend'
subhead: By introducing a 5% income tax on the wealthiest Omanis starting in 2028, the sultanate becomes the first Gulf country to implement such a measure. It is a way to anticipate a decline in oil revenues as global crude prices continue to trend downward, writes Le Monde columnist Isabelle Chaperon.

title: A different perspective on erotic cinema
subhead: A French festival dedicated to erotic film is holding its 10th edition until June 29 in several cinemas across the Paris region.

title: What satellite images reveal about US strikes in Iran
subhead: Three Iranian nuclear facilities were struck by the US overnight between June 21 and 22. Satellite footage analyzed by Le Monde pinpoints the precise impact sites of the bombs and, where visible on the surface, the extent of the damage.

title: 'Jaws' turns 50: A foundational film that changed cinema
subhead: The incredible success of Steven Spielberg's film, released simultaneously across the US at the very start of summer 1975, was the result of a wild gamble by Universal that revolutionized Hollywood, writes Le Monde's Michel Guerrin in his column.

title: The Heritage Foundation sets its sights on Europe
subhead: Since the beginning of his term, Donald Trump has been applying Project 2025, a 922-page bible written by the conservative think tank. Today, its president, Kevin Roberts, is looking across the Atlantic. On a visit to France, he met with leaders of far-right parties.
